Last year, more than $3.8 billion of work was done through Upwork by skilled professionals who are gaining more control by finding work they are passionate about and innovating their careers.

The Analytics & Data Science team is looking for an analyst to drive measurement of our Enterprise Product efforts. This role is critical in understanding market trends, customer needs, and competitive landscapes to inform the development and enhancement of our product offerings for enterprise clients. This individual will drive insights and partner cross-functionally with product management, engineering, and analytics to compel changes in our strategy.

As a critical member of the Analytics & Data Science team, you’ll use your quantitative background and expertise in manipulating large datasets to bring unparalleled insights into user behavior and site performance. If you enjoy building businesses with endless possibilities, this is a great opportunity!

Become the authority on user behavior for our Enterprise Product team, applying data science techniques and analytical skills to unearth deep insights on the customer journey.Define the metrics teams use to evaluate their success, perform analysis to understand the impact on growth, and track progress toward those results.Present in key meetings and business reviews with our product leadership.Tackle complex problems inherent to a double-sided marketplace. Deliver insights that drive changes in product strategy


What it Takes to Catch our Eye:

Ability to drive analytics projects end-to-end in a fast-paced environment.Passion for getting into the details.Strong SQL skills.Proficiency in one or multiple BI tools such as Looker or Domo.Proficiency in Python or R a plus. Previous experience in a marketplace or e-commerce business.

Group1001’s culture emphasizes the importance of collaboration, communication, core business focus, risk management, and striving for outcomes. Gainbridge, a part of the Group 1001 enterprise, is a self-managed, innovative, digital platform providing its clients with direct access to trusted financial products to smartly grow their savings over time. Gainbridge strives to offer products through its platform that are simple, intuitive, and backed by smart technology with no complexity or hidden fees. Gainbridge empowers clients to take control of the financial future with simple solutions that are accessible to everyone no matter their budget.

Group 1001, and its affiliated companies, is strongly committed to providing a supportive work environment where employee differences are valued. Diversity is an essential ingredient in making Group 1001 a welcoming place to work and is fundamental in building a high-performance team. Diversity embodies all the differences that make us unique individuals. All employees share the responsibility for maintaining a workplace culture of dignity, respect, understanding and appreciation of individual and group differences.

Lead Product Analyst

We're looking for a Lead Product Analyst who is highly empathetic, motivated, and passionate about solving hard problems in the financial services space. Discover new places, and you're excited to join our mission of revolutionizing the annuities industry. Ready to make an impact on a national scale by helping to support our Product Org with strong data analytics and research. Passionate about data analysis, visualizations, SQL, and A/B testing. Sound like you? Then read on.

This role will report to the Director of Product Management.

Responsibilities

Drive 50% growth in new-to-Gainbridge customers compared to 2023.You are NOT responsible for data strategy or data engineering.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several U.S. geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $100,000/year in our lowest geographic market up to $140,000/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Benefits Highlights: 

Employees (and their families) are eligible to participate in the Company’s comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plan options. Employees are also eligible for Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance, Short and Long-Term Disability, and to enroll in the Company’s Employee Assistance Program and other wellness initiatives. Employees may also participate in the Company’s 401K plan, with matching contributions by the Company.

Your Background, Skills And Experience

Required Experience:

Education or experience with technical, user, and business issues in a technical organizationDemonstrated analytical and quantitative skills, using data and metrics to support assumptionsDemonstrated ability to collaborate and achieve actionable results in a team settingCritical thinking and the ability to translate ideas into actionOrganized and consistent project delivery with a focus on prioritized execution, quality, and timeliness

Intuit Dome is an iconic new arena designed for optimal and intimate engagement of community and fans. The LA Clippers' new home will redefine the live event experience and raise the bar for sustainability by design. Description

At Audible, we believe stories have the power to transform lives. It’s why we work with some of the world’s leading creators to produce and share audio storytelling with our millions of global listeners. We are dreamers and inventors who come from a wide range of backgrounds and experiences to empower and inspire each other. Imagine your future with us.

As an Advanced Analytics Lead at Audible, you will drive the design, implementation, and delivery of Analytics solutions in a highly ambiguous and significantly complex problem space that will have a long-term impact on the business, organization, and technology. You will deliver solutions that address significantly large or endemic customer and business problems, and directly impact the goals of our Analytics, Marketing, Product and/or Content organizations. You are a “doer”, someone that can code at a very good level in SQL and Python, and deliver products or prototypes end-to-end (from conception, to design, to specification, to code, to test, to measurement, to presentation). You connect the dots and understand system inter-dependencies and limitations to build efficient solutions. You have an outstanding business acumen that helps you speak fluently in your business partners’s language, and helps them achieve or surpass their goals. You work fast and deliver reliably against your commitments. You can frame hypotheses, decisions, and assumptions into a testable structure and develop robust experimental designs.

As a Advanced Analytics Lead, you will...

 Partner with data scientists, BIEs and business leaders to understand, conceive, design, code, test, measure and present ground breaking Analytics-, Science- and Data-products that bring Audible to the next stage on its way to a thought-leading, world-class Data-Driven business Own some analytics product end-to-end, and contribute to others Possess an in-depth knowledge of all relevant data sources, business intelligence technologies, data science and analytical tools – know what’s possible, in which direction to steer, and how to move fast with solutions, adjustments and recommendations Communicate verbally or in writing to business customers and leadership to share insights and recommendations

Audible is the leading producer and provider of audio storytelling. We spark listeners’ imaginations, offering immersive, cinematic experiences full of inspiration and insight to enrich our customers daily lives. Our Hub+Home hybrid workplace model gives employees the flexibility between gathering in a common office space (work from hub) and remote work (work from home). Newark, NJ, USA

 5+ years of relevant experience in the areas of Strategic Analytics, Business Intelligence, Data Science, or Consulting in a digital environment or in a related field Degree in science, economy, technology, mathematics or a related field Demonstrated high achievement in prior roles, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence Strong experience working in ecommerce analytics, marketing analytics, experimentation/AB testing, membership/loyalty analytics and revenue management techniques Strong experience in spearheading or supporting business initiatives through data-driven decision frameworks, in particular through the conception, execution, and measurement of experimental A/B plans, measurement frameworks, decision making systems, simulation and scenario tools, and data science models Strong hands-on experience in developing data-driven products (ML models, forecasting tools, etc.) with programming languages (Python, R) Strong expertise in scripting languages (such as SQL, VBA, etc.) and the tools (such as MS excel, PowerPoint, etc.) Experience in developing visualization tools and scorecards such as Tableau, Microstrategy, Shiny, etc., and analytics/presentation, and sharing business recommendations and their financial/customer impact with the stakeholders

Preferred Qualifications

 MS degree (Sciences, Operations Research (OR), Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar field), Business (MBA) or equivalent experience Experience in a similar business environment (entertainment industry, subscriptions businesses, digital commerce)

 About TikTok U.S. Data Security
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible. 
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day. 
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. 
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve. 
Join us.

About the team
The User Growth team focuses on driving new user acquisition programs through various performance marketing channels and strategies. They develop and improve in-app features to drive installs and user retention. The USDS UG team simultaneously focuses on growth strategies within our US market and helps improve global teams.

In order to enhance collaboration and cross-functional partnerships, among other things, at this time, our organization follows a hybrid work schedule that requires employees to work in the office 3 days a week, or as directed by their manager/department. We regularly review our hybrid work model, and the specific requirements may change at any time.

Responsibilities
- Familiar with user growth businesses, and understand user growth product functions and strategies
- Responsible for user growth deep dives, investigation, testing strategy and other growth-related business requirements and provide guidance to deliver all key project milestones and outcomes to optimize growth results-related strategies
- Work independently as the evaluation and investigation project designer, deeply understand the business, and be responsible for the overall process of the project, including planning, implementation and providing high-quality evaluation analysis to help with product optimization
- Work closely with PM and RD to elaborate and optimize relevant evaluation standards or guidelines and output project SOPs to ensure that the evaluation meets expectations
- Work closely with multiple business partners to ensure business metrics improvement and workflow optimization
- Other Ad-hoc and relevant projects as assigned 

Qualifications

 - Bachelor's degree or above in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or related technical/quantitative fields
- 3+ years of professional experience in an analytical role involving user growth/product optimization/business analytics/performance marketing
- In-depth understanding of user growth strategies of social media platforms or mass consumer products
- Experience in SQL/Excel/R/Python/Tableau. Familiar with common statistical methods and applications (A/B testing, probability, regression) 
- Good communication skills as a collaborative team player in across-cultural and cross-functional environment. Ability to synthesize and communicate complex concepts and analyses in an easy to understand way
- Able to manage cross-functional operational efforts, working with data delivery, engineering, and product teams to ensure the smooth rollout of projects
- Passionate about user growth, social media and short video products

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. 

TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws. If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at usds.accommodations@tiktokusds.com

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
ClickUp is the world’s only all-in-one productivity platform that flexes to the way people want to work. It replaces all individual workplace productivity tools with a single, unified platform that includes project management, document collaboration, whiteboards, spreadsheets, and role-based AI tools. Our dedication to enhancing productivity has earned us recognition on prestigious lists including the Forbes Cloud 100, Fast Company's Most Innovative Companies, Inc. Power Partners and #1 on two of G2's Best Software Products Lists for 2023 - #1 Project Management Product and #1 Collaboration and Productivity Product. With our headquarters based in San Diego and a rapidly expanding global presence, we are shaping the future of work. Join our team at ClickUp, one of the fastest-growing SaaS companies worldwide, and help millions of users be more productive - saving them at least one day every week. 🦄

At ClickUp data is the key driver behind the decisions we make every day. Our teams rely on accurate and up to date data to measure their success and to build a better product. An ideal candidate would have strong SQL skills, experience conducting experiments and advising PMs on experimentation best practices, and the ability to answer challenging business/product questions through the use of a data warehouse and raw data sources.

The Role:

Partner with product managers and executives to help drive product decisions by extracting meaningful insights from large sets of data.Spearhead ClickUp's experimentation efforts in Product. Design and run A/B tests, develop best practices on experimentation, and forge processes that enable the team to run fast, meaningful experiments, extracting valuable insights from results.Turn loosely defined problems into practical analyses.Acquire a deep understanding of our users and contextual data nuances, interpreting and conveying findings to key stakeholders.Develop a strong business sense and understanding of business performance drivers.Utilize proactive and autonomous initiative to understand the needs of the org and drive forward the right project while also supporting others that can benefit from your expertise.Data Stack: Snowflake, SQL, DBT, Eppo, Segment, Amplitude, Tableau, Hex, AWS.

Qualifications:

4+ experience as a Product Analyst or Product Data Scientist with 2+ years experience in SaaS.A strong understanding of software business principles and SaaS metrics.Proven expertise in conducting and interpreting A/B tests.Proficiency with BI tools (Tableau, Looker, QuickSight) and event tracking platforms (Segment, Heap, etc...).Advanced skills in SQL transformations and relational databases.Self-motivated, operationally-focused, and a problem-solver.Excellent interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Desirable:

Extensive knowledge of Amplitude and event instrumentation.Knowledge of product led growth initiatives and monetization/engagement drivers.Experience building statistical models using Python or R.

Salary Range: $145,000 - $212,500 (base pay)

This position is eligible for the following benefits:

Equity401(k) with up to 2% matchClickUp swagTeammate recognition awardsProfessional development programHealth insuranceDental insurancePaid parental leaveFlexible paid time offSabbatical programWellness stipend

ClickUp was founded on a culture of hard work, consistent growth, and a desire to break norms. We’re a values-driven company and hire based on ambition, merit, and a willingness to do what it takes to succeed. We don’t care where you’re from, what you look like, or who you’re in a relationship with—we hire the best people for the job, and create an environment that supports employees on their journey to do the most exciting work of their lives! ClickUp is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

ClickUp collects and processes personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you are a European Job Applicant, see our privacy policy for further details.

About Rokt

Rokt is the global leader in ecommerce technology. We unlock revenue for companies by using AI and machine learning to present highly relevant offers to each shopper, personalizing the online shopping experience and maximizing the value of each transaction moment. Uber, Live Nation, AMC Theatres, PayPal, Hulu, Staples, Lands' End, GoPuff, HelloFresh are among the more than 2,500 leading global businesses and advertisers relying on Rokt's technology to increase engagement, revenue and customer acquisition.

With our December 2022 secondary transaction, Rokt's valuation increased to $2.4 billion. We are expanding rapidly and operating in 15 countries across North America, Europe and Asia-Pacific with the largest office in NYC and a major R&D hub in Sydney. With consistent hyper growth ahead of the market and a vibrant company culture, Rokt has been listed in ‘Great Places to Work' in the US and Australia.

About Rokt'stars

As a mission-driven, hyper-growth community of curious explorers, our ambition is to unlock the full potential in ecommerce and beyond. Our bias for action means we are not afraid to quickly venture into uncharted territories, take risks or challenge the status quo; in doing so we either win or learn. We work together as one aligned team never letting egos get in the way of brilliant ideas. We value diversity, transparency and smart humble people who enjoy building a disruptive business together. We pride ourselves on being a force for good as we make the world better.

Requirements

About the role

This role is dedicated to empowering the Rokt Product Development team by providing comprehensive data-driven insights. The goal is to facilitate the creation of highly relevant and exceptional experiences for both clients and customers.

Responsibilities

Partner with Product and Engineering teams through analyses, reporting, and generate valuable insights to aid in decision makingConduct quantiatative analyses on partner, advertiser, and customer behavior to help Product Managers and Engineering refine their product strategyCreate and maintain dashboards and reports to baseline and monitor Product usage and company-wide metricsDefine measurement frameworks and analyze key metrics and to inform decision-making and measure success Offer thought partnership to stakeholders by deconstructing problem statements into quantitative hypotheses and proposing associated analysesCollaborate with the product team to set SMART goals for the organization and implement methods to track progressUnderstand the drivers that impact our north star metric, and propose A/B testing roadmaps to influence various Product teams

Requirements

Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Operations Research, Economics, Statistics or an equivalent quantitative field6+ years of experience in AnalyticsDeep SQL skills and proficiency in working with big data and ETL managementExperience in working in Amazon Redshift or Google BigQueryAutonomous, detail-oriented, and comfortable with breaking down ambiguous problems into quantitative solutionsPassion for extracting actionable insights that move the business forwardExperience with visualization and reporting tools such as Tableau, Looker, etc Strong stakeholder management experienceTeam player who positively contributes to the culture of the Analytics team and RoktExperience communicating results and business impact of analytical deep dives to senior leadership

Preferred Qualifications

5+ years of experience in Product Analytics2+ years of experience analyzing ecommerce dataFamiliar with data mining and data engineeringPython/R experience strongly preferredExperience with statistical analyses and familiarity with basic machine learning

 Work with the greatest talent in tech. Our recruitment process is tough but diligent. We're constantly aiming to implement our value of "raise the bar" and set high standards for our Rokt'stars. Accelerate your career. We want you to unlock your full potential. This is why we have an annual ‘Level Up' allowance of $5,000 that gives Rokt'stars the ability to take courses, attend events, go to training, and more to help our great employees become even better.  Take a break. When you work hard, we know you also need to rest. We offer generous time off and parental leave policies, as well as mental health and wellness days for all employees. We even incentivize individuals to utilize their PTO with "High 5" days, an additional 5 days of PTO when you've used 75% of your allotted annual paid leave. We also offer a paid Rokt'star Sabbatical for employees who have been with us for 5 years or more Become a shareholder. All Rokt'stars have stock options. If we succeed, everyone is rewarded.  See the world! We want our Rokt'stars to enjoy the ride. Title: Sr. Product Analyst
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers — intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

Position Summary

We are seeking a talented and motivated Sr Product Analyst with a strong background in AdTech to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing, optimizing, and driving the performance of our advertising technology products. Your insights and expertise will play a crucial role in enhancing user engagement, maximizing revenue, and ensuring seamless user experiences across our mobile applications.

Key Responsibilities:

AdTech Expertise

Develop a deep understanding of our AdTech stack, including ad serving platforms, ad formats/ delivery experiences, supply and demand dimensions, partner programming requirements, campaign scoring, budget pacing, audience management and user-level targeting capabilities.

Monitor and analyze key advertising performance metrics, such as click-through rates (CTR), conversion rates, impression delivery, and ad revenue.

Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to optimize ad placements, ad targeting, and overall user engagement to maximize revenue and user satisfaction.

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement ad-related enhancements and ensure alignment with product strategy.

Conduct A/B tests and analyze user behavior to make data-driven recommendations for improving user experience, as well as app/ad performance across our network

Possess strong familiarity with the Android ecosystem, including the latest OS versions, device fragmentation, and user behavior trends.

Evaluate the impact of Android updates on our applications' performance, including app compatibility, user interactions, and advertising integration.

Data Analysis and Insights:

Dig deep. You will utilize data analytics tools to perform in-depth analysis of user engagement, ad performance, and app usage patterns across dozens of supply-side dimensions.

Make data accessible. You will query, clean, analyze, and visualize datasets, building product performance dashboards and workbooks using data visualization tools and pivot tables to effectively communicate performance trends to stakeholders.

Draw Insights. You will highlight key findings, generate actionable insights, and propose optimizations/ recommendations based on data, contributing to product roadmaps and strategies.

Be the “SME”. You are the go-to person when someone asks questions like: “is this feature working”, “when do these events fire”, “how should we interpret this graph”, or “what does this value mean”.

Define “healthy”. You will help to define performance expectations and monitoring requirements for new features so that we can quickly identify when issues arise.

Collaboration and Communication:

Work closely with product managers, software developers, and UX/UI designers to drive product enhancements and feature development.

Assist data science with discovery, investigations and insights to steer the development of machine learning algorithms.

Collaborate with engineering teams to troubleshoot technical issues.

Effectively communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, promoting a clear understanding of product performance and potential improvements.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field. Master's degree is a plus.

Proven experience (5+ years) in product analytics, experimentation, conversion and growth optimization, data science, and/or product management in the AdTech domain

Proficiency in data analysis tooling such as SQL, Python or similar languages.

Strong analytical mindset with the ability to interpret complex data and derive actionable insights.

Natural tendency to be curious and creative

Familiarity with mobile application development, Android Studio, and related SDKs.

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.

Detail-Oriented, self-motivated, and able to work both independently and as part of a team.

Prior experience with A/B testing methodologies and statistical analysis is a plus.

About Digital Turbine:

Digital Turbine (NASDAQ: APPS) powers superior mobile consumer experiences and results for the world’s leading telcos, advertisers and publishers. Our end-to-end platform uniquely simplifies the ability to supercharge awareness, acquisition and monetization — connecting our partners to more consumers, in more ways, across more devices.

The company is headquartered in Austin, Texas, with global offices in New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, London, Berlin, Singapore, Tel Aviv, and other cities serving top agency, app developer, and advertising markets. Listed on Deloitte Technology Fast 500 for six consecutive years since 2015 and winner of Austin Chamber of Commerce’s Company Culture in 2020.

Digital Turbine is an equal opportunity employer committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives. We embed diversity in our mindset, products, and teams to empower an inclusive, equitable, and culturally fluent environment. Building this culture within our teams makes us better collaborators and partners, driving better outcomes.
